title: Progress Bar
reference-overview: Progress Bar is used to provide graphical view of the progress of a specific step or action. It represents a static view of the current status. It is not intended to be a dynamic representation of the user's progress on the task or step.
reference-usage:
It should be used within a complex or multi-stepped process, one that is not expected to be completed within a single user session. Examples include Tasks, Implementations or Renewals.

If the task is simpler or will be completed within a single "flow", use one of the "Stepper" options - either Horizontal or Vertical depending on the circumstance.
reference-details:
States

There are three states:

  • Red - Needs Attention or Just Started
  • Yellow - Midpoint or In Progress
  • Green - Almost Completed

Variables

Each of these states will be defined as variables as a specific percentage - with the total being 100%.

For example:

  • Red = 33%
  • Yellow = 33%
  • Green = 34%

Colors

The three colors are expressed as gradients - light to dark - within the imagery:

  • Red - #fcdbd9 to #ba2c2b
  • Yellow - #fef8e3 to #f1d485
  • Green - #d6ebc to #2b7b05

Associated Text

The actual percentage status number should be displayed to right of the Progress Bar, vertically aligned.

Size

  • Size of Text
  • Size of Images
  • Anything else
